landingText: Prepare for practical interviews or just solve programming problems for fun using our app!
contributeProblemHomeText: We strive to offer a pleasant and useful experience. A such, we continiously try to  provide relevant problems . If you've come across an interesting problem that is not yet part of our database, we invite you to contribute to the improvement of our platform by opening a contribution request
contributeProblemQuestionTip: The title should be concise and the description well formulated containing enough details so that the objective of the problem is understood
contributeProblemSolutionTip: Pseudocode or the general idea behind the solution for the problem
contributeProblemTestcaseTip: Pairs of input and output examples for the problem
contributeProblemToastSuccessDetail: Contribution added succesfully. You may return back.
contributeProblemToastErrorDetail: Unable to add contribution. You may try again
contributeProblemHomeFetchError: Previous contributions could not be loaded.
errorPageForbiddenStatus: Not enough rights to perform the operation
errorPageBadRequestStatus: The operation being performed is not permitted
updateContributionToastSuccessDetail: Contribution updated successfully. You may return back.
updateContributionToastErrorDetail: Unable to update contribution. You may try again
deleteContributionConfirmMessage: Are you sure you want to delete this contribution?
assignedContributionsTip: Accept or reject assigned contributions through their individiual pages. Accepting a contribution means you'll have to supply the implementation of it's solution in all the supported languages and a rejection must be accompanied by furhter details
unassignedContributionsTip: To begin working on a contribution you need to assign it first. This step is necessary to avoid situations in which two developers work on the same contribution. Once assigned the contribution will appear in the assigned contributions tab, from where it can be accepted or rejected.
rejectContributionTip: To be as trasparent as possible every rejected contribution must be accompanied by the specific reason it is being rejected for
codeStepTip: To advance to the next step the solution and starter code must be surounded in // starter and // solution comments and every solution must run without errors at leat once
mustRunCodeFirst: You must run your code first
completeAdditionalDataStepTip: Choose an appropriate difficulty and select all applicable categories
problemAddedSuccessfully: Problem was added successfully. You can go back
testcasesStepTip: The solutions must run successfully and provide consistent results
